projects.description:
This game engine is written in C# and uses OpenGL via Silk.NET. At the moment it is more of a render engine though, because there is very little game logic code implemented.

Why C# and not C++? - Because I didn't feel comfortable enough with C++ at the time to tackle such a large project.

Features:

  • Entity-Component-System
  • Physically based rendering
  • Dynamic directional and omnidirectional shadows
  • Cascaded shadow maps
  • Material system
  • Model loading
  • Texture loading

projects.description:
The first game I ever worked on. I developed it in Unity and it was inspired by Hollow Knight and God of War. As I was learning programming and game development with this project, I created some really tasty spaghetti, which ultimately led to me never finishing the game as the code just wasn't anywhere near maintainable.

Nevertheless, it had some pretty cool combat mechanics (demo video on the next slide) :D

Features:

  • God of War like combat system
  • Three unique weapons with unique magic attacks
  • Absorb blood from the environment to heal
  • Artefact system:
    • Link artefacts to weapons
    • Artefacts grant unique effects to the linked weapon
    • When all artefacts of a single set are linked to the same weapon it gains an additional effect, sometimes even changing the weapon's playstyle
